steps.title: Prepare your lollipop molds.
steps.content: Prepare your lollipop molds. Spray them with nonstick cooking spray so you'll be able to remove the finished lollipops without them cracking. Put the lollipop sticks in the molds. [2] X Research source This recipe works with any type of hard candy molds. You can use drop molds, start or heart-shaped molds, or any other mold you like. Be sure to use candy molds, and not other types of food molds, since candy molds are designed to prevent the candy from sticking.

steps.title: Add the ingredients in a saucepan.
steps.content: Add the ingredients in a saucepan. Place the sugar, corn syrup, and water in a saucepan. Put the saucepan on the stove over medium high heat. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Stir the mixture until the sugar dissolves.
steps.content: Stir the mixture until the sugar dissolves. Scrape down the sides of the pan with a pastry brush to keep it from sticking.

steps.title: Bring the mixture to a full boil.
steps.content: Bring the mixture to a full boil. Stop stirring and check the temperature with a candy thermometer. Let the mixture keep boiling until it reaches 295 째F (146 째C), then immediately remove it from heat. It's important to remove the sugar mixture from heat at this exact temperature. Use a candy thermometer, and not a meat thermometer, to be sure your measurements are exact.

steps.title: Stir in the extract and food coloring.
steps.content: Stir in the extract and food coloring. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Spoon the candy mixture into the lollipop molds.
steps.content: Spoon the candy mixture into the lollipop molds.

steps.title: Let the lollipops harden before popping them out.
steps.content: Let the lollipops harden before popping them out.

steps.title: Mix the sugar and water in a large jar.
steps.content: Mix the sugar and water in a large jar. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Stir the mixture well.
steps.content: Stir the mixture well.

steps.title: Add the food coloring and flavor.
steps.content: Add the food coloring and flavor. Rock candy takes on a beautiful hue that is accentuated by it's natural rock shape. Pick a color and flavor that complement each other. You can try one of these classic combinations or come up with your own: Purple rock candy with lavender flavoring. Orange rock candy with tangerine flavoring. Pink rock candy with rose flavoring. Red rock candy with cinnamon flavoring.

steps.title: Suspend the wooden skewers in the solution.
steps.content: Suspend the wooden skewers in the solution. Place them evenly around the jar and lean them against the lip of the jar. Secure them in place with small pieces of tape, so they don't slide against each other while the rock candy forms. You can use wooden chopsticks in place of skewers. A string suspended from a pencil is also a good base for rock candy. Cover the jar with plastic wrap. This prevents dust and bugs from getting into the jar while the rock crystals form.

steps.title: Wait for the sugar to form into rocks.
steps.content: Wait for the sugar to form into rocks. It takes a week or two for the sugar to crystallize into the shape of pretty rocks attached to the skewers. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Dry the rock candy.
steps.content: Dry the rock candy. When you're happy with the size of the rocks, remove the skewers from the jar and lay them out to dry.

steps.title: Butter a 15 x 10 x 1 pan.
steps.content: Butter a 15 x 10 x 1 pan. If you don't have one exactly this size, find another wide, shallow pan. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Combine the sugar, water and corn syrup in a pan.
steps.content: Combine the sugar, water and corn syrup in a pan. Place it on the stove over medium high heat, and stir until the sugar dissolves.

steps.title: Bring the mixture to a boil.
steps.content: Bring the mixture to a boil. Stop stirring and let it reach 270 degrees, making sure to check with your candy thermometer for the exact temperature. Remove it from heat.

steps.title: Add the butter, honey, salt and rum extract.
steps.content: Add the butter, honey, salt and rum extract.

steps.title: Stir the mixture until it reaches 300 degrees Fahrenheit (149째C).
steps.content: Stir the mixture until it reaches 300 degrees Fahrenheit (149째C). [8] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the mixture from heat.
steps.content: Remove the mixture from heat.

steps.title: Pour it into the buttered pan.
steps.content: Pour it into the buttered pan.

steps.title: Cool the candy for 5 minutes.
steps.content: Cool the candy for 5 minutes.

steps.title: Score the candy with a knife.
steps.content: Score the candy with a knife. Use the knife to make diagonal score marks across the candy or make it as big as you want, so it'll be easier to break apart.

steps.title: Cool the candy completely.
steps.content: Cool the candy completely.

steps.title: Break the candy along the score marks.
